sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: Fun and Philanthropy Collide During The Amazeum's Ungala
posts.content:
Have fun for a great cause during the Scott Family Amazeum's UnGala presented by Nabholz, the museum's annual FUNdraiser for ages 21+, where you can play like a kid, eat, drink, and experience one-of-a-kind activities that spark creativity and curiosity, on Apr 21, from 6-10p.

  • Never too old to play: There will be so many hands-on experiences to try, like light painting, wood turning, percussion art, a build-your-own-scent bouquet station, and even an adult-size ball pit. When you need a break from the activities, enjoy the all-you-can-eat food truck buffet and tipsy chemistry cocktails presented by Spectrum Brands!
  • For the kids: The Ungala supports the Amazeum's nonprofit mission to keep the cost of general admission low, host Priceless Nights, and provide professional development opportunities for local educators.

Who are you inviting to the UnGala next weekend? Get your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Brighten Your Garden With A Hanging Basket
posts.content:
Find a gorgeous hanging basket to make your home pop with color this spring during Peel Compton Foundation's annual fundraiser, the Hanging Basket Sale.

  • Great Gifts: Baskets cost $25 and can be pre-purchased online for pickup on May 11-13 at Peel Museum & Botanical Garden, just in time to surprise Mom with a gift this Mother's Day!
  • Preservation: All proceeds from the sale will support the preservation of Arkansas history and make beautiful botanical garden spaces accessible to Northwest Arkansas.

Pre-purchase your hanging baskets HERE.

posts.title: Level Up Your Skills At The Fayetteville Public Library
posts.content:
The first cohort of Fayetteville Public Library's Level Up Skills Development programs is set to begin on Apr 15, with applications currently open for the Skilled Trades certification program.

  • Skills Simulator: Many of the programs utilize virtual reality simulated training. Additional programs in Computer Training and Heavy Equipment Operation will begin accepting applications on May 1.
  • Empowerment: The programs, which are funded by the Friends of Fayetteville Public Library and ARPA funds, aim to provide opportunities for all residents, with a focus on those disproportionately impacted by COVID-19, to achieve higher-wage occupations.

Learn more about these programs and other business-oriented classes HERE.

posts.title: New Fay Jones Exhibit At Shiloh Museum Of Ozark History
posts.content:
Shiloh Museum of Ozark History has opened a fascinating digital exhibit on the works of Fay Jones called Housing the Human and the Sacred, which utilizes gaming technology and touch screens to explore Jones' architecture in 3D.

  • All-Time Great: Jones is a legendary architect and a University of Arkansas alumnus whose designs utilize simple materials like stone, wood, and glass. His most famous work is the Thorncrown Chapel near Eureka Springs, which the American Institute of Architects lists as one of the most significant buildings of the 20th century.
  • Hands-On History: Shiloh Museum has several exciting and educational exhibits, including hands-on activities where you can explore the extraordinary history of the Arkansas Ozarks from prehistoric to modern times.

Find more information about Shiloh Museum's current exhibits HERE.

posts.title: Sting To Perform At Walmart AMP This October
posts.content:
The Walmart AMP has a stellar lineup for the 2023 Concert Series and recently announced the addition of The All-American Rejects, performing Oct 10, and rock legend Sting, performing Oct 12.

  • On stage: The 2023 Season kicks off Apr 21 with Walker Hayes, followed by some exciting shows throughout the summer and into the fall, such as Dave Mathews Band, Snoop Dogg, and Jason Aldean.
  • New features: The AMP will feature several new add-ons this season, including the AMP Underground, an all-ages club located under the Choctaw Plaza with a private bar, food menu, live video of ongoing shows, and priority venue entry.

The All-American Rejects and Sting tickets go on sale tomorrow, Apr 14, HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Summer Fun: Kickstart your summer planning during Macaroni Kid's Summer Camp & Activity Expo at the Jones Center on Saturday, Apr 15, from 12-2p. There will be vendors, free activities, and bounce houses for the kids to enjoy. Register HERE for free and a chance at a $100 gift card!*
  • Love Songs: Saying "I love you" can be hard. So why not try singing it? Book your next date night at Big Box Karaoke and show them how you really feel ðŸŽ¤ðŸ˜˜ . Reserve your spot HERE.*

  • Smooth Flying: Learn how to attract butterflies to your gardnes during the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks' Butterfly Gardening class on Tuesday, Apr 18, from 6-7:30p. 
  • Artists Wanted: Main Streets Siloam Springs is looking for artists to submit works for the Downtown Then & Now Project. The deadline is Apr 28 at 5p.
